meanings.definition: Subject to duty or customs tax.
meanings.sent1: The imported goods were dutiable, so we had to pay an extra fee.
meanings.sent2: It is important to check if the items you are bringing are dutiable.
meanings.sent3: The dutiable items seemed to have a secret tax attached to them.
meanings.sent4: The concept of dutiable goods felt like a heavy burden on our wallets.
meanings.sent5: The dutiable products were like magnets for additional charges.

meanings.definition: Able to be taxed or subject to duty.
meanings.sent1: Certain items are dutiable, meaning they can be taxed by the government.
meanings.sent2: Always check the list of dutiable items before traveling internationally.
meanings.sent3: The dutiable products almost seemed to invite taxes upon themselves.
meanings.sent4: The idea of being dutiable made the objects feel vulnerable to extra charges.
meanings.sent5: The store had a section dedicated to dutiable goods, ready for taxation.

meanings.sent1: The dutiable transaction required careful consideration of tax implications.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the dutiable nature of the purchase helped in budget planning.
meanings.sent3: The party had a playful game where guests had to guess the dutiable amount.
meanings.sent4: The dutiable situation felt like navigating through a maze of taxes.
meanings.sent5: Dealing with dutiable matters required attention to financial responsibilities.
